bjad.common

Class DurationUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • bjad.common.DurationUtil

  • public class DurationUtil
extends Object
    Utility class used to determine duration with milliseconds or nanoseconds.
    Author:
    Ben Dougall

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected long endTime
      The end time for the duration measurement
      protected long startTime
      The start time for the duration measurement
      protected boolean useNanoSeconds
      Flag to state if milliseconds are going to be used

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DurationUtil()
      Creates the millisecond duration util, setting the start time to the current time.
      DurationUtil(boolean useNanoSeconds)
      Creates the duration util, setting if we are using nanoseconds if true is passed, milliseconds if false is passed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getMilliseconds()
      Returns the number of milliseconds elapsed.
      long getNanoseconds()
      Returns the number of nanoseconds elapsed.
      String getSecondsString()
      Returns the duration in seconds.
      String getSecondsString(int decimalPlaces)
      Returns the dureation in seconds, rounding to the decimal places passed.
      void start()
      Sets the start time for the duration marker.
      void stop()
      Sets the end time for the duration marker.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • startTime

        protected long startTime
        The start time for the duration measurement

      • endTime

        protected long endTime
        The end time for the duration measurement

      • useNanoSeconds

        protected boolean useNanoSeconds
        Flag to state if milliseconds are going to be used

    • Constructor Detail

      • DurationUtil

        public DurationUtil()
        Creates the millisecond duration util, setting the start time to the current time.

      • DurationUtil

        public DurationUtil(boolean useNanoSeconds)
        Creates the duration util, setting if we are using nanoseconds if true is passed, milliseconds if false is passed. The start time is also marked to the current time.
        Parameters:
        useNanoSeconds - True to measure in nano-seconds, false to measure in milliseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Sets the start time for the duration marker.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Sets the end time for the duration marker.

      • getSecondsString

        public String getSecondsString()
        Returns the duration in seconds.
        Returns:
        The duration, as a string, in seconds rounded to 5 decimals.

      • getSecondsString

        public String getSecondsString(int decimalPlaces)
        Returns the dureation in seconds, rounding to the decimal places passed.
        Parameters:
        decimalPlaces - The number of decimal places to round to.
        Returns:
        The number of seconds, as a string rounded to the decimal places passed.

      • getMilliseconds

        public long getMilliseconds()
        Returns the number of milliseconds elapsed.
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds elapsed.

      • getNanoseconds

        public long getNanoseconds()
        Returns the number of nanoseconds elapsed.
        Returns:
        The number of nanoseconds elapsed (if using milliseconds, its not exact).
